Posts.Content: My fathers PSA was 3600 Gleason 9. He entered into a study in Houston in July of this year. After 3 treatments 8 weeks apart his PSA in now under 100 with minimal side effects. This treatment is already approved in Germany. Its a receptor that adheres to the tumor while the German based medicine ( lutetium 177) thats inside the receptor kills the cancer. German data generally says up to 80% respond favorably. This is a targeted therapy that wont kill good cells like chemo does. The study is taking in 200 patients in the US. Houstons Excel Diagnostic and nuclear oncology center and somewhere at Stanford California. Theres no doubt in my mind, after data is completed this will be FDA approved. The treatment is not covered by insurance. 15k for 1st treatment and 10k for the next 3 treatments. Plus any travel you might have. Study calls for 4 treatments. You must prove a rising PSA and you must of took Zytiga or xtandi. Before. Also there are blood analysts requirements. Joe pope
Posts.Title: Dad with metastatic prostate cancer, is there hope?
